issues.description: Problem statement text refers to REST endpoints using the prefix '/api' (e.g. 'PUT /api/persons/{personId}/parents'), but both the template and solution controllers map endpoints to paths without the '/api' prefix (e.g. @PutMapping("persons/{personId}/parents")). This mismatch between the documented endpoint paths and the actual mappings will confuse students when they try to call or test the endpoints as described in the instructions.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the documentation and code consistent. Either (a) update the problem statement to refer to endpoints without the '/api' prefix (e.g. 'PUT /persons/{personId}/parents'), or (b) add the '/api' base path to the controllers (for example add @RequestMapping(path = "/api", consumes = ..., produces = ...) at the class level for PersonResource and TestingResource) so the mapped URLs match the examples in the problem statement.

issues.description: The template's PersonResource.createPerson(...) method is declared public, while the solution's implementation lacks the 'public' modifier (package-private). This visibility mismatch between template and solution can confuse students comparing both code bases and may lead to unexpected behavior or questions about required visibility for controller handler methods.
issues.suggested_fix: Use the same visibility in both template and solution to avoid confusion. Prefer making the solution method 'public' to match the template (i.e., change the solution's createPerson signature to 'public ResponseEntity<Person> createPerson(...)'). Alternatively, update the template to match the intended (and tested) visibility if package-private is deliberate—but prefer 'public' for controller handler methods for clarity.
